page.title: 16LIFESTYLES - Hotel, Pub
page.content: The Filly Inn is situated on the verge of the A337 at Setley 1.75km south of Brockenhurst and giving a beautiful view across open forest towards Sway. Formerly known as the 'Oddfellows Arms' the Filly Inn is a free house and is patronised by people of all ages. It has a peaceful atmosphere and can cater for all tastes. The dimly lit interior gives a good effect to the decor which consists mainly of farming and fishing implements of yesteryear. Seating is available outside but this can become noisy in the summer when the A337 becomes busy with holiday traffic. This public house serves pub lunches at reasonable prices; they consist of cold meats, hot dishes and, of course, chips.
